messages.subject: Re: Seems We Were All Wrong
messages.msgSnippet: ... Lynda, I m beginning to think I m the only one who gets your sense of humor. Bridget
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Lynda" <lurine@s...> wrote:
> It was a "ho ho," tongue in cheek thing, Joyce.
>
> Lynda

Lynda,

I'm beginning to think I'm the only one who 'gets' your sense of
humor.

Bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Seems We Were All Wrong
messages.msgSnippet: ... Though I don t claim to know the intricacies of domain names and such, I think it s just a blank page, not really supported by anyone. Or perhaps by
messages.messageBody:
on 3/29/02 2:28 AM, Lynda at lurine@... wrote:

> Goggle gave me this instead www.unschooling.info and it
> sure seems we were all wrong with regards to what unschooling is. I mean,
> it does say unschooling info, so they must be experts if they have gone to
> the expense of getting a domain name.

Though I don't claim to know the intricacies of domain names and such, I
think it's just a blank page, not really supported by anyone. Or perhaps by
someone sitting on it waiting for someone to offer them money for it. If you
click on Whois? it turns up Mark Williams of New World Concepts, Inc. Which,
if you type both names into Google, it turns up a web hosting service and a
few UFO sites. (There's a main page for the UFO stuff at http://anw.com/).
I'm not sure the New World Concepts, Inc. that's a web *design* serivce is
the same (http://www.newworld-concepts.com/).

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: Seems We Were All Wrong

messages.messageBody:
Just recently, I saw the term applied to people who drop out of high
school because they aren't getting what they need there. (can't
remember whose column it was, but it was in my newspaper this week)

Bridget

messages.subject: Seems We Were All Wrong
messages.msgSnippet: Well, as I went merrily surfing around the net, aiming at the unschooling boards, dear ol Goggle gave me this instead www.unschooling.info and it sure seems
messages.messageBody:
Well, as I went merrily surfing around the net, aiming at the unschooling
boards, dear ol' Goggle gave me this instead www.unschooling.info and it
sure seems we were all wrong with regards to what unschooling is. I mean,
it does say unschooling info, so they must be experts if they have gone to
the expense of getting a domain name.

Lynda
